page.title: 14Transport in the Hurn block.
page.content: In Holbeach Hurn village itself there is no public transport at all.One service bus does come through the block.That is the market day bus that comes through Holbeach St. Marks and down the marsh road twice a week on Thursdays and Saturdays.It is run by one of the local coach operators and not by Lincolnshire Road Car.This bus goes into Holbeach in the morning and comes back at about 3 o'clock.School children are entitled to free transport and are picked up in the centre of Holbeach Hurn or at appointed stopping places along the route.Apart from this people have to rely on their own transport and a second vehicle is not uncommon.Often it is a van or landrover used in connection with work.Nearly everyone owns and uses a bike.Mr.Jenkinson runs a minibus into Holbeach on Saturdays.
